intro: Phyllorkis caudata, commonly known as the long-tailed phyllorkis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stem and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers, which are typically visited by nectar-feeding insects. Phyllorkis caudata is often found in heathlands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils.
